title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Zingerla is inefficiently using its resources and/or does not explain that it is producing at a point inside its production possibilities curve.
The response states that Zingerla is inefficiently using its resources and explains that it is producing at a point inside its production possibilities curve.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Zingerla has the comparative advantage in the production of lemons and/or does not explain that Zingerla has the lower opportunity cost in producing lemons: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of lemons in Zingerla is 1/30 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38FA@ unit of oranges and in Springland it is 1/20 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38F9@ unit of oranges

The response states that Zingerla has the comparative advantage in the production of lemons and explains that Zingerla has the lower opportunity cost in producing lemons: the opportunity cost of producing one unit of lemons in Zingerla is 1/30 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38FA@ unit of oranges and in Springland it is 1/20 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@38F9@ unit of oranges

title: Part C
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that yes, Zingerla will gain from trade and/or does not explain that Zingerla would have to give up 30 lemons per one orange without trade and Zingerla only has to give up 25 lemons per one orange with trade.

The response states that yes, Zingerla will gain from trade and explains that Zingerla would have to give up 30 lemons per one orange without trade and Zingerla only has to give up 25 lemons per one orange with trade.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not state that Springland has the absolute advantage in the production of oranges and/or does not explain that after the production of oranges quadruples, Springland can produce a maximum of 12 oranges and Zingerla can produce a maximum of 8 oranges with the same amount of resources.

The response states that Springland has the absolute advantage in the production of oranges and explains that after the production of oranges quadruples, Springland can produce a maximum of 12 oranges and Zingerla can produce a maximum of 8 oranges with the same amount of resources.

title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not calculate the number of unemployed people in Springland as 12 million and/or does not show the work.
